document_title: Helicobacter pylori infection: Signs and treatment
subsection_name: nhiem-khuan-hp.json_6_Measures to prevent infection with H.p
subsection_content:
Washing your hands regularly helps prevent infections, including H.p
Patients can reduce the risk of H.p. infection by:
Wash hands properly with soap after going to the toilet and before eating; Do not consume food that is not thoroughly cooked or shows signs of rancidity, mold, or infection; Drink clean water and use clean water when preparing food (this should be especially noted if you live in an area with polluted water sources).; Limit food consumption at sidewalk stalls, which do not ensure food hygiene and safety factors.
To treat H.p. completely and avoid recurrence, patients need to seriously follow the doctor's treatment regimen, take medicine on time, in the right dose, and build a healthy, hygienic diet to get well soon.
